metadata.title: CVE-2018-6151 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
Bad cast in DevTools in Google Chrome on Win, Linux, Mac, Chrome OS priorto 66.0.3359.117 allowed an attacker who convinced a user to install amalicious extension to perform an out of bounds memory read via a craftedChrome Extension.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6151` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
